io.cettia.asity.http

Class AbstractServerHttpExchange

  • java.lang.Object
    • io.cettia.asity.http.AbstractServerHttpExchange
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    ServerHttpExchange
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    AtmosphereServerHttpExchange, GrizzlyServerHttpExchange, NettyServerHttpExchange, ServletServerHttpExchange, VertxServerHttpExchange

    public abstract class AbstractServerHttpExchange
extends Object
implements ServerHttpExchange
    Abstract base class for ServerHttpExchange.
    Author:
    Donghwan Kim

    • Method Detail

      • header

        public String header(String name)
        Description copied from interface: ServerHttpExchange
        Returns the first request header associated with the given name.
        Specified by:
        header in interface ServerHttpExchange

      • read

        public ServerHttpExchange read()
        Description copied from interface: ServerHttpExchange
        Reads the request body. If the request header, content-type, starts with text/, the body is read as text, and if not, as binary. In case of text body, the charset is also determined by the same header. If it's not given, ISO-8859-1 is used by default.

        The read data will be passed to event handlers as String if it's text and ByteBuffer if it's binary attached through ServerHttpExchange.onchunk(Action).

        This method should be called after adding ServerHttpExchange.onchunk(Action), ServerHttpExchange.onbody(Action), and ServerHttpExchange.onend(Action) and has no side effect if called more than once.

        Specified by:
        read in interface ServerHttpExchange

      • readAsText

        public ServerHttpExchange readAsText()
        Description copied from interface: ServerHttpExchange
        Reads the request body as text. The charset is determined by the request header, content-type. If it's not given, ISO-8859-1 is used by default.

        The read data will be passed to event handlers as String attached through ServerHttpExchange.onchunk(Action).

        This method should be called after adding ServerHttpExchange.onchunk(Action), ServerHttpExchange.onbody(Action), and ServerHttpExchange.onend(Action) and has no side effect if called more than once.

        Specified by:
        readAsText in interface ServerHttpExchange

      • readAsText

        public ServerHttpExchange readAsText(String charsetName)
        Description copied from interface: ServerHttpExchange
        Reads the request body as text using the given charset.

        The read data will be passed to event handlers as String attached through ServerHttpExchange.onchunk(Action).

        This method should be called after adding ServerHttpExchange.onchunk(Action), ServerHttpExchange.onbody(Action), and ServerHttpExchange.onend(Action) and has no side effect if called more than once.

        Specified by:
        readAsText in interface ServerHttpExchange

      • readAsBinary

        public ServerHttpExchange readAsBinary()
        Description copied from interface: ServerHttpExchange
        Reads the request body as binary.

        The read data will be passed to event handlers as ByteBuffer attached through ServerHttpExchange.onchunk(Action).

        This method should be called after adding ServerHttpExchange.onchunk(Action), ServerHttpExchange.onbody(Action), and ServerHttpExchange.onend(Action) and has no side effect if called more than once.

        Specified by:
        readAsBinary in interface ServerHttpExchange

      • doRead

        protected abstract void doRead(Action<ByteBuffer> chunkAction)

      • onchunk

        public ServerHttpExchange onchunk(Action action)
        Description copied from interface: ServerHttpExchange
        Attaches an action to be called with a chunk from the request body. The allowed data type is String for text body and ByteBuffer for binary body.
        Specified by:
        onchunk in interface ServerHttpExchange

      • onend

        public ServerHttpExchange onend(Action<Void> action)
        Description copied from interface: ServerHttpExchange
        Attaches an action to be called when the request is fully read. It's the end of the request.
        Specified by:
        onend in interface ServerHttpExchange

      • onbody

        public ServerHttpExchange onbody(Action action)
        Description copied from interface: ServerHttpExchange
        Attaches an action to be called with the whole request body. The allowed data type is String for text body and ByteBuffer for binary body. If the body is quite big, it may drain memory quickly. If that's the case, use ServerHttpExchange.onchunk(Action) and ServerHttpExchange.onend(Action).
        Specified by:
        onbody in interface ServerHttpExchange

        public ServerHttpExchange setStatus(HttpStatus status)
        Description copied from interface: ServerHttpExchange
        Sets the HTTP status for the response.
        Specified by:

      • end

        public ServerHttpExchange end()
        Description copied from interface: ServerHttpExchange
        Completes the response. Each exchange's response must be finished with this method when done. It's the end of the response. This method has no side effect if called more than once.
        Specified by:
        end in interface ServerHttpExchange

      • onclose

        public ServerHttpExchange onclose(Action<Void> action)
        Description copied from interface: ServerHttpExchange
        Attaches an action when the underlying connection is aborted for some reason like an error. After this event, all the other event will be disabled.
        Specified by:
        onclose in interface ServerHttpExchange

      • onerror

        public ServerHttpExchange onerror(Action<Throwable> action)
        Description copied from interface: ServerHttpExchange
        Attaches an action to be called when this exchange gets an error. It may or may not accompany the closure of connection. Its exact behavior is platform-specific and error created by the platform is propagated.
        Specified by:
        onerror in interface ServerHttpExchange
